column5: Looking for advise on LOTW houseboats in early July to target walleye, 1st time houseboaters so any help would be appreciated .Thanks
LOTW is a huge area. What area are you planning to visit?
open to suggestions, I would assume the Canada side?

As always, I suggest Morson. Morson Marina has house boats, with reasonable rates. http://wildernesshouseboats.com/ Awesome fishing areas... quite remote. There's a nice camp in the area that is happy to help out if a houseboat needs anything! lol All kidding aside, its a very good area.

Kenora has some house boats. You would probably head south to the barrier islands. Find a bay and anchor up as base camp. Some houseboats out of Sioux Narrows also. You would head out past Whitefish narrows & Yellow Girl point.
I have never rented one, but I sure think it would be much better to stay at a local resort than a house boat.

We use floating lodges out of sioux narrows and absolutely love it. We park the houseboat 6 hours out from sioux narrows and work our way back a little every couple of days. It depends on where you fish weather a houseboat or resort is best for your situation.
